summary: The diff implements a comprehensive Wingo game platform covering backend logic, frontend UI, and neon theming. All three major requirements appear substantially implemented. The backend includes round management, bet storage, payout logic, and query/update endpoints. The frontend covers the lobby, countdown timer, round history, betting panel, result modal, and bet history table. Neon theming is applied throughout. Minor gaps exist around the backend's round resolution trigger and whether rounds are persisted with winning numbers after resolution.

missing_requirements.requirement: Expose an update function to trigger round resolution that persists winning number and color result
missing_requirements.reason: The getCurrentRound function in the visible backend code returns winningNumber=null and colorResult=null always, constructing the round on-the-fly from Time.now() without persisting resolved results. An explicit resolveRound update function that stores winners and computes payouts is not clearly present in the truncated diff.

hallucinated_features.description: User profile system with name setup including ProfileSetupModal, saveCallerUserProfile, and getCallerUserProfile endpoints
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request does not mention a user profile or player name system. The frontend includes a mandatory profile setup modal and the backend exposes profile CRUD endpoints that were never requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Role-based authorization and access control system with admin and user roles using MixinAuthorization and AccessControl
hallucinated_features.reason: The build request does not specify any role-based access control or admin system beyond basic Internet Identity authentication. The backend imports and enforces admin/user permission checks on multiple endpoints.

hallucinated_features.description: How to Play instructional section rendered in the game lobby
hallucinated_features.reason: A How to Play section was not requested anywhere in the build specification.
